pr_title: [1.2.2] Fix hasfiller value for BFiniteType created for const literals

timeline.author: MaryamZi

timeline.message:
Add default filler value check for const unions

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>

Add test cases for union filling

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>

Fix list-expr filler value check for Union

Const Types or singleton values were comparison does not check the type
but does a `==` check for BFiniteType.

Now filler value check will specially handle Unions with BFiniteType.
Its Types will be flattened and collected together and check for is same
type on the collected list. Default filler value check still process
BFiniteType without flattening it.

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>

Fix code formatting suggestions in code review

Removed recursive finite flattening as bad logic. Refactor variable
names for clarity. Revert unwanted code changes.

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>

Add default filler value check for const unions

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>

Add default filler value check for const unions

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: I think we should rename this to hasFillerValue and isImplicitDefaultValue to isFillerValue.
timeline.author: MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: We could change the parameter to Set<BLangExpression> instead to avoid ambiguity.
replies.author: MaryamZi

timeline.author: MaryamZi
MaryamZi

replies.bodyText: Since it's not really unique and we get the types.
replies.author: MaryamZi
